Author: Office of Academic Affairs, F.O.S. College
Title: Placement Test Announcement
Content:
The Office of Academic Affairs has arranged for all senior students to undergo the Placement Test. This test is organized in conjunction with the Youth Center. There will also be classroom observations organized by the Youth Center. The relevant matters are announced as follows:
I. The exam will commence at 10:00 on this coming Thursday and will last four weeks.
II. Things to note:
1. Cheating of any form, whether direct or indirect, is strictly prohibited. Offenders' grades will be nullified.
2. Attendees must ensure the camera is constantly recording until the test is finished.
3. The list of attendees and medical checkup arrangements have been announced on the website of the Office of Academic Affairs.
4. This test is organized in conjunction with the Youth Center where professionals will be observing. May all attendees please do their best in the test.
Please thoroughly read through the test content and rules in the attachments.

Author: Office of Academic Affairs, F.O.S. College
Title: Regarding the Unlocking of the Message Board
Content:
The system has verified that the first base station has been cleared. Please upload your combat data and collect the base station-related notice.
Also, the message board for students and observers will be unlocked in 30 minutes.
Things to note:
I. This message board is for internal communication only. Please be kind to others.
II. This message board is for the discussion of this test and observation experiences, please refrain from posting unrelated content.
III. Offenders will be penalized.
IV. No need to reply to this notice.

Author: Student ID 1600
Title: First
Content:
First comment!
The supply point is easy to clear. I heard from a senior before that the graduation exam always lacks supplies, probably to save face in front of the observers.
But according to the way some teachers set the questions, it may become very difficult afterward.
Anyway, remember to prepare enough resources. Good luck, everyone.

Author: Student ID 1569
Title: Thank you
Content: Thanks to those who came to help!\nIt's my first time requesting for dispatch. I thought I'd be able to handle it alone, but I didn't want to fail early on so I had to call for backup in the end... I guess the teachers wanted to emphasize the importance of teamwork with this test. Co-op missions are also important in the area, so don't refuse to accept help and not request for dispatch.

Author: Student ID 1495
Title: It hurts...
Content:
I got hit by a stray bullet when doing the Special Mission. Currently using my aching arm to write this message, I can't even move my shoulder. Fortunately, I can still fight.
I feel like the pain simulation module has been amped up to 5 (?) this time... Be careful, everyone.
Luckily, someone was kind enough to patch me up.
Small edit: Turns out, everyone else's modules were set to 7, the teacher just came over to adjust mine.
Nothing else to add to this thread.

Author: Student ID 1499
Title: Lost my recording device
Content: It was quite chaotic when I was raiding the Dark Block and I lost my recording device. Now I can't upload my records. I hope this won't affect my grades...\nRequesting for a new device requires time. If anyone finds my device, please return it to me!\nI'll do anything!

Author: Student ID 1442
Title: Regarding standard pistols
Content:
Everyone knows not to choose pistols when choosing weapons since we're taught that pistols lack stability, precision, and range compared to other weapons in battle.
But I've changed my mind after watching a graduation exam record footage of a senior. I am also going to become a pistol master.
My scores have improved quite a lot in pistol simulation training recently, and now it's time to put my skills to the test!
Edit: There are quite a few doubters in the comments, but I've just successfully participated in a base station raid. Personally, I think the difference in weapons can be compensated by one's skills.
Edit 2: By the way, can we change equipment or weapons at the next supply point? There's just some equipment damage, nothing wrong with pistols.

Author: Student ID 1532
Title: Found a lost terminal
Content: I found a portable terminal after accepting a Support Mission. The lock screen is a character from "Ocean Brawl". I'm currently at the supply point, if this is your device, please come pick it up.\nOn a side note, the recent updates in "Ocean Brawl 2" are so good! The first one was already good but this is even better.\nIf anyone wants to get into the series, I'm in room 1077.

Author: Student ID 1444
Title: I have understood the tactics
Content: After a period of observation, I've found that enemies deal more damage with long-range attacks compared to close-range attacks, so the key is to close the distance with your target quickly.\nI've been hit with weapons of mass destruction before, so as long as you fortify your defenses and create geological advantages, the battle should be way easier.\nWe need to be decisive as students of F.O.S.! You're more likely to get hit by long-range attacks, close combat is the key to success.

Author: Student ID 1526
Title: To the one who said close combat is the key to success!
Content: I dare you to reveal yourself!!\nI almost failed because of you. Give me back my points!\nI couldn't even send out a support signal. Spreading misinformation and making random judgments can go very wrong!

Author: Youth Center
Title: Youth Center
Content:
Congratulations to all for completing this session. Well done!
We have collected some comments from the observation experiences in the past two weeks which we would like to pass on to all students.
Everyone is so cool when battling! I also want to become a student at F.O.S.!
It's so exciting! Good luck to the guy flying the aerial vehicle!
I have learned the values of F.O.S. students through this experience, which includes bravery, self-improvement, and solidarity. I will strive to become an F.O.S. student.
After seeing the battle scenes on the surface, I have decided that I want to become a doctor at Star of Life so that fewer people will suffer in the future.

Author: Student ID 1490
Title: Wreck-It Bear friend request
Content: As above. Since there are more people here now I thought I'd try my luck here. Is anyone in the Youth Center (can they see this thread?) playing Wreck-It Bear? Let's be friends after the exams! It's my current fixation.\nMy friend code is in the attachments.\nEdit: my friend list is full, let me reorganize my list, wait.

Author: Office of Academic Affairs, F.O.S. College
Title: Notice
Content:
Attention attendees:
Posting or discussing content unrelated to the test is prohibited. Offenders have been penalized.
Student ID 1532: muted
Student ID 1490: muted and deduction of points in this area.

Author: Youth Center
Title: The importance of serum
Content: I thought it would be a battle in the Clean Zone. Who would've guessed the simulation would include the spread of the Punishing Virus... There were a lot of people asking for serum support in the end.\nIt's not that we couldn't have pushed through it, it's just that it would've slowed down the team's progress. I guess it's true that the battlefield is ever-changing and you need to be prepared for it. If you need serum, I have some here. Hope we can all hang on till the next supply point raid.\nTap to see attachment: coordinates.

Author: Student ID 1511
Title: Looks familiar?
Content:
I finally broke through the Dark Block.
Everyone's probably seen videos of the surface before, right? Do you get a sense of deja vu after this test?
I heard from our seniors that this is what happens on the surface every day. While we stand in a simulated battlefield, this is actually happening over and over again for real on the surface.
Joining the F.O.S. was the most important decision I have ever made. I aim to graduate as valedictorian so that these kinds of tragedies don't repeat themselves anymore!

Author: Student ID 1549
Title: Just a suggestion
Content: We encountered a waterway during the operation, and for a landlubber like me, it was quite the challenge... Youth Center, if you can see this, please add swimming classes!\nI wonder if there are dry clothes at any supply points.\nAnd hopefully, my little brother didn't see how embarrassing I was.

Author: Student ID 1435
Title: Professor, seriously?
Content: My god, the Corrupted before the base station are too scary! Is this the difficulty of a mid-term test...\nEdit (4:35): What I meant was that the professor who designed this test is brilliant. All possible situations we may face on the battlefield were taken into account, can't have designed it better myself. It's not a malicious comment.\nI swear.

Author: Student ID 1417
Title: Team up in Dark Block?
Content: I've reached the final Dark Block but I need a team to advance.\nThere's a bit of power overflow when I tried to increase output and I also got separated from my original team, so now I need a team that has a few Tanks. Preferably, we can keep being a team until graduation.

Author: Student ID 1495
Title: What happened??
Content: What? Why am I the one fighting?\nI'm a part of the scout team and am mainly responsible for planning, so why is my team suddenly the team closest to the Dark Block?\nWell, it feels good to be acknowledged by those who we've saved, but it shouldn't be my turn so soon! Sigh, I guess I just need to hang on till backup arrives...

Author: Office of Academic Affairs, F.O.S. College
Title: End of Exam Notice
Content:
Attention to all attendees, the graduation exam is nearing the end. In order to guarantee a smooth finish for all attendees, please read the following notices:
I. Information regarding the exam end time and the retrieval of combat recordings will be sent to your terminals momentarily. Please read through the information carefully and complete the exam before the deadline.
II. Things to note:
1. You may continue practicing in the final block to earn points after the end of the exam.
2. The points ranking will not be the only criterion for the final exam results. Visit the website of the Office of Academic Affairs for more details on the weightings.
3. The exam results will be announced in 3 working days after the end of exam. Check your terminals for updates.
